lead_paragraph: The president’s engagement policy and Raúl Castro’s minor opening to free-market ideas have created a new dynamic for Cuba that reveals what the country could become with more freedom to evolve.

headline.print_headline: With Obama’s Visit to Cuba, Old Battle Lines Fade
headline.main: With Obama Visit to Cuba, Old Battle Lines Fade

snippet: The president’s engagement policy and Raúl Castro’s minor opening to free-market ideas have created a new dynamic for Cuba that reveals what the country could become with more freedom to evolve.
abstract: Reporter's Notebook; halting dynamic between Pres Barack Obama and Cuban leader Raul Castro during first visit to island by sitting United States president serves to illustrate changing relationship between countries themselves; Obama's engagement policy and Castro’s small steps toward opening Cuba to free-market ideas and careful criticism are new and perhaps revealing look at Cuba's future.
